summary: This bill, the Combating Organized Retail Crime Act, aims to address the growing issue of organized retail crime. It amends Title 18 of the U.S. Code to give law enforcement more legal tools related to the theft of goods. It also establishes an Organized Retail and Supply Chain Crime Coordination Center within the Department of Homeland Security to coordinate federal, state, and local efforts, share information, and track trends. The bill further mandates the evaluation of existing federal programs offering grants, training, and support to combat this crime.
